com.verisign.getdns

Class GetDNSContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.verisign.getdns.GetDNSContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGetDNSContext, IGetDNSContextAsyncWithCallback, IGetDNSContextWithCallback

    public class GetDNSContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGetDNSContext, IGetDNSContextWithCallback

    The design here is slightly different from the C API in the following ways:

    • Return the object created or the response
    • Throw an exception in case of any issues

      • generalSync

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> generalSync(java.lang.String name,
                                                               RRType requestType,
                                                               java.util.HashMap<ExtensionName,java.lang.Object> extensions)
                                                                 throws GetDNSException

        This method is used for looking up any type of DNS record. 

         HashMap<String, Object> info = context.generalSync("gmadkat.com", RRType.valueOf("CNAME"), null);
        Parameters:
        name - a representation of the query term; usually a string but must be a dict (as described below) in the case of a PTR record lookup
        requestType - a DNS RR type as a getdns constant (listed here)
        extensions - (optional) a dictionary containing attribute/value pairs
        Returns:
        DNS response
        Throws:
        GetDNSException

      • generalAsync

        public GetDNSFutureResult generalAsync(java.lang.String name,
                              RRType requestType,
                              java.util.HashMap<ExtensionName,java.lang.Object> extensions)
                                throws GetDNSException

        This method is used for looking up any type of DNS record. 

        GetDNSFutureResult result = context.generalAsync("verisigninc.com", RRType.valueOf("A"), null);
 HashMap<String, Object> info = null;
 info = result.get(5000, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
        Parameters:
        name - a representation of the query term; usually a string but must be a dict (as described below) in the case of a PTR record lookup
        requestType - a DNS RR type as a getdns constant (listed here)
        extensions - (optional) a dictionary containing attribute/value pairs
        Returns:
        Throws:
        GetDNSException

      • addressSync

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> addressSync(java.lang.String name,
                                                               java.util.HashMap<ExtensionName,java.lang.Object> extensions)
                                                                 throws GetDNSException

        The name argument can only take a host name.

        There are three critical differences between getdns_address() and getdns_general() beyond the missing request_type argument:

        • In getdns_address(), the name argument can only take a host name.
        • You do not need to include a return_both_v4_and_v6 extension with the call in getdns_address(): it will always return both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
        • getdns_address() always uses all of namespaces from the context (to better emulate getaddrinfo()), while getdns_general() only uses the DNS namespace

        Parameters:
        name - host name
        extensions - (optional) a dictionary containing attribute/value pairs
        Returns:
        DNS response
        Throws:
        GetDNSException

      • serviceSync

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> serviceSync(java.lang.String name,
                                                               java.util.HashMap<ExtensionName,java.lang.Object> extensions)
                                                                 throws GetDNSException
        it must be a domain name for an SRV lookup. The call returns the relevant SRV information for the name
        Parameters:
        name - domain name
        extensions - (optional) a dictionary containing attribute/value pairs
        Returns:
        DNS response
        Throws:
        GetDNSException

      • hostnameSync

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> hostnameSync(java.lang.String address,
                                                                java.util.HashMap<ExtensionName,java.lang.Object> extensions)
                                                                  throws GetDNSException,
                                                                         java.net.UnknownHostException

        it takes both IPV4 AND IPV6 address. 

         HashMap<String, Object> info = context.hostnameSync("2001:4860:4860::8888", null);
        Parameters:
        address - IPV4 or IPV6 Address
        extensions - (optional) a dictionary containing attribute/value pairs
        Returns:
        Throws:
        GetDNSException
        java.net.UnknownHostException

        The name argument can only take a host name.

        • You do not need to include a return_both_v4_and_v6 extension with the call in getdns_address(): it will always return both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
